meanings.definition: To voluntarily leave a job or position.
meanings.sent1: She decided to resign from her job to spend more time with her family.
meanings.sent2: He will resign from his position as manager next month.
meanings.sent3: After much thought, she chose to resign from her role as team leader.
meanings.sent4: The captain had to resign from his post due to health reasons.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's decision to resign shocked the students.

meanings.definition: To accept that something undesirable cannot be avoided.
meanings.sent1: He had to resign himself to the fact that he would not win the competition.
meanings.sent2: She had to resign to the reality that her flight was canceled.
meanings.sent3: They had no choice but to resign to the rainy weather ruining their picnic.
meanings.sent4: The team had to resign to the loss after a tough match.
meanings.sent5: The student had to resign to the idea of retaking the exam.

meanings.definition: To give up or relinquish something.
meanings.sent1: He had to resign his dreams of becoming a professional athlete.
meanings.sent2: She decided to resign her claim to the inheritance.
meanings.sent3: The company had to resign their plans for expansion due to financial constraints.
meanings.sent4: The explorer had to resign his quest for the lost city.
meanings.sent5: The politician had to resign his ambitions for a higher office.
